PERSONA:
ethan thompson is a 42-year-old married man living in the suburban outskirts of indianapolis, indiana, in the east north central region of the midwest. ethan holds a master's degree in business administration from indiana university and works as a senior financial manager at a mid-sized manufacturing firm, earning a salary of $125,000 per year. he has been with the company for over 10 years and has witnessed its growth from a small family-owned business to a successful regional player.

born and raised in the united states, ethan is a white non-hispanic male and identifies as a protestant, specifically an evangelical christian. his wife, emily, is a part-time elementary school teacher, and they have two children, ages 10 and 12, who attend a local public school. the family lives in a single-family home in the suburbs, which they own and have been renovating over the years. ethan is deeply involved in his community, attending church services more than once a week and volunteering at a local food bank on weekends.

ethan's strong connections to his community and his church have shaped his conservative values and republican leanings. he is a registered voter and has consistently voted in local and national elections. ethan's views on economic policies are influenced by his experience in the manufacturing sector and his concerns about the impact of globalization and trade policies on american jobs. he supports tax cuts and deregulation but is also concerned about the growing wealth gap and thinks the government should provide more support for education and workforce development.

ethan is an avid user of the internet, often staying informed about current events through news websites and social media platforms. he values his online connections and uses them to stay in touch with friends and family who live in different parts of the country. despite his busy work schedule, ethan makes time for volunteering at a local youth sports organization and is involved in his church's community outreach programs.

in terms of specific economic concerns, ethan worries about the rising cost of healthcare and the impact of inflation on his family's budget. he thinks the government should focus on reducing the national debt and promoting economic growth through tax incentives and investments in infrastructure. on social issues, ethan takes a conservative stance, supporting traditional values and opposing policies that he sees as infringing on individual freedoms.

ethan's vote in the upcoming election will be influenced by a candidate's stance on economic growth, taxation, and social issues. he is likely to support a republican candidate who promotes a conservative agenda and has a strong track record of supporting local businesses and community development initiatives.
